availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of John D. Mannen and Mary "Polly" Leet Mannen. Resident of Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1850. Resident of Warren County in 1860. Household owned four enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Second District, 126B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Second District, p.431.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District No. 1, p. 432A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Elk Spring District, p. 148B.
